title: Cognitive Load Theory-Informed Social Studies Instructional Design Strategies

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic sociology concepts and general experience in educational environments
context.additional_context: A course where adult learners master cognitive load theory-based social studies curriculum design for K-12 settings. Blends digital/analog resources in BYOD environments

learning_goals: Systematically segment social studies lesson content by analyzing learners' cognitive load levels.
Design audiovisual materials, activities, and assessment tools based on cognitive load theory for novice/intermediate learners.
Identify at least three cognitive load factors occurring during class using formative assessment data and propose improvement measures.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
